org.unbunt.ella.engine.corelang
Interface Engine

All Superinterfaces:
SQLResultProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
EllaCPSEngine
public interface Engine
extends SQLResultProvider

Represents the native interface to be implemented by a virtual machine for the ella language.

The native interface is the API element used by native objects to interact with the execution engine.

Method Detail

isClosureReturnInProgress

boolean isClosureReturnInProgress()

toBoolean

boolean toBoolean(Obj value)
Returns the boolean value corresponding to the given EllaScript object.

The boolean value is false, if the object is equal to either the false or the null core object. Otherwise the value is true.

TODO: This method exists for performance reasons only and should be removed eventually.

Parameters:
value - the EllaScript object to convert to a boolean.
Returns:
the corresponding boolean value.

trigger

void trigger(Obj obj,
             Obj context,
             Obj... args)
Triggers activation of the given EllaScript object, which should be an activatable object. The activation is started when control returns to the evaluating engine.

Parameters:
obj - the EllaScript object to trigger activation for.
context - the activation context the object is to be invoked with. May be null.
args - the arguments passed as part of the invocation.

trigger

void trigger(Primitive prim,
             Obj context,
             Obj... args)

Parameters:
prim - the primitive call to trigger activation for.
context - the activation context the primitive call is to be invoked with. May be null.
args - the arguments passed as part of the invocation.

trigger

void trigger(Func func,
             Obj context,
             Obj receiver,
             Obj... args)
Triggers activation of the given EllaScript function. The activation is started when control returns to the evaluating engine.

Parameters:
func - the function to trigger activation for.
context - the activation context the primitive call is to be invoked with. May be null.
receiver - the object where the function was looked up in. Available within the function as via the super keyword. May be null.
args - the arguments passed as part of the invocation.

invokeOnReceiver

Obj invokeOnReceiver(Obj call,
                     Obj context,
                     Obj receiver,
                     Obj... args)
Invokes the given object, which should be activatable.

Parameters:
call - the activatable object to be invoked.
context - the activation context the object is to be invoked with. May be null.
receiver - the object where the function was looked up in. Available withing the function via the super keyword. May be null.
args - the arguments passed as part of the invocation.
Returns:
a value to be used as the result of the evaluation. May be null, to indicate the value of last evaluation should be preserved.
Throws:
ClosureTerminatedException - indicates the invocation has to end abruptly because of a return operation triggered from inside a block closure.

               Obj slot,

                        Obj slot,

invokeBlock

Obj invokeBlock(Block block)
Evaluates the given EllaScript program fragment.

Parameters:
block - the program fragment to evaluate.
Returns:
a value to be used as the result of the evaluation. May be null, to indicate the value of last evaluation should be preserved.
Throws:
ClosureTerminatedException - indicates the invocation has to end abruptly because of a return operation triggered from inside a block closure.

invokeInLoop

Obj invokeInLoop(Obj obj,
                 Obj context,
                 Obj... args)
                 throws ClosureTerminatedException,
                        LoopBreakException,
                        LoopContinueException
Installs a looping construct and invokes the given EllaScript object, which should be activatable. Any calls to the language's looping control facilities from within the invocation will result in a LoopBreakException or LoopContinueException to be thrown to indicate the loop should be terminated or restarted immediatly.

Parameters:
obj - the activatable object to be invoked.
context - the activation context the object is to be invoked with. May be null.
args - the arguments passed as part of the invocation.
Returns:
a value to be used as the result of the evaluation. May be null, to indicate the value of last evaluation should be preserved.
Throws:
ClosureTerminatedException - indicates the invocation has to end abruptly because of a return operation triggered from inside a block closure.
LoopBreakException - indicates the loop should be terminated.
LoopContinueException - indicates the loop should be restarted immediatly.
